meanings.definition: Depriving someone of the right to vote.
meanings.sent1: The new law was disfranchising many citizens.
meanings.sent2: The government was accused of disfranchising certain groups.
meanings.sent3: The idea of a cat disfranchising a dog from voting is quite amusing.
meanings.sent4: The storm was like disfranchising the town from sunlight for days.
meanings.sent5: The image of chains disfranchising people from the ballot box is powerful.

meanings.definition: Excluding someone from a privilege or right.
meanings.sent1: The exclusive club was disfranchising those without connections.
meanings.sent2: The policy seemed to be disfranchising the less fortunate.
meanings.sent3: It's like disfranchising someone from dessert after dinner.
meanings.sent4: The heavy rain was disfranchising the plants from much-needed sunlight.
meanings.sent5: The strict rule was disfranchising students from participating in the event.
